1.text: Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.

2.text: The chief priests and the scribes were looking for a way to do away with Jesus [by killing him], but they feared the people.

3.text: Then Satan entered into Judas, surnamed Iscariot, who was numbered with the Twelve.

4.text: So Judas went and talked with the chief priests and scribes and officers of the guard about how he might deliver Jesus to them.

5.text: They rejoiced and agreed to give him money.

6.text: Judas agreed and began to look for an opportunity to deliver him to them when there would be no crowd.

7.text: Then the day of unleavened bread came, on which the Passover must be sacrificed.

8.text: So Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat [the Passover meal].”

9.text: They asked him, “Where do you want us to make preparations?”

10.text: Jesus replied, “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.

11.text: Then tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’

12.text: He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.”

13.text: They went, found things as Jesus had told them, and made preparations for the Passover.

14.text: When the hour had come, he sat down with the Twelve apostles.

15.text: He said to them, “With fervent desire I have desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer,

16.text: for I tell you, I will no longer eat of it until it is fulfilled in the Kingdom of God.”

17.text: Then, taking a cup and having given thanks, he said, “Take this, and share it among you,

18.text: for I tell you, I shall not drink from the fruit of the vine until the Kingdom of God comes.”

19.text: And having taken bread and given thanks, he broke it and gave [it] to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.”

20.text: Likewise, he took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is to be poured out for you.

21.text: But behold, the hand of the one who betrays me is with me at the table.

22.text: And the Son of Man indeed is going, as it has been determined, but woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!”

23.text: Then they began to discuss among themselves which of them it was who would do this thing.

24.text: An argument also arose between them about which one of them was considered to be the greatest.

25.text: Jesus said to them, “The kings of the nations have lordship over the people, and those who have authority over people are called ‘benefactors.’

26.text: But not so with you! Instead, the one who is the greater among you should become as the younger, and the one who is leading as the one who serves.

27.text: Indeed, who is greater, the one reclining at the table, or the one who serves? Is it not the one at the table? Yet, I am among you as one who serves.

28.text: But you are those who have remained with me in my trials,

29.text: and now I bestow a kingdom upon you, just as my Father bestowed [a kingdom] upon me,

30.text: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom; and you will sit on thrones, judging the Twelve tribes of Israel.”

31.text: And the Lord said, “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan has asked to have you, so that he might sift you [all] like wheat!

32.text: But I have prayed for you, that your faith would not fail. And you, when you have turned back, strengthen your brethren.”

33.text: But Simon said, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”

34.text: At this Jesus replied, “I tell you, Peter, before the rooster crows today, you will deny three times that you know me!”

35.text: Then Jesus asked them, “When I sent you out without purse, bag, or sandals, did you lack anything?” They replied, “Nothing.”

36.text: He then said to them, “But now, whoever has a purse should take it, and likewise a bag! Whoever has no sword should sell his cloak and buy one!

37.text: For I tell you that what is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ Indeed, the things [written] concerning me are [reaching] a completion.”

38.text: So the disciples exclaimed, “Lord, behold, here are two swords!” but he told them, “That is enough!”

39.text: Jesus came out, and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him.

40.text: Having arrived at the place, he said to them, “Pray that you do not enter into temptation!”

41.text: He then withdrew from them about a stone’s throw [away], knelt down and prayed,

42.text: saying, “Father, if you are willing, take this cup away from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.”

43.text: And an angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him.

44.text: Being in agony, he prayed [even] more intensely, and his sweat became like great drops of blood falling down on the ground.

45.text: When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples and found them sleeping because of sheer grief.

46.text: He said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation!”

47.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a multitude [came], and the one who was called Judas, one of the Twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him.  This is the sign he had given them, saying, “Whoever I will kiss is the one.”

48.text: but Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”

49.text: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”

50.text: And one of them struck the slave of the high priest, cutting off his right ear.

51.text: But Jesus said, “Let me at least do this”—and he touched the servant’s ear, and healed him.

52.text: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and presbyters who had come against him, “Have you come out as against someone leading a rebellion, with swords and clubs?

53.text: When I was with you in the temple every day, you did not stretch out your hands against me! But this is your hour, and the power of the darkness.”

54.text: They arrested him and led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed from a distance.

55.text: When people had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter also sat among them.

56.text: A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, she exclaimed, “This man also was with him!”

57.text: However, Peter denied [him], saying, “Woman, I do not know him!”

58.text: A little while later, someone else saw him, and said, “You also are one of them!” But Peter answered, “Sir, I am not!”

59.text: After about one hour had passed, another insisted, saying, “Truly, this man also was with him, for he is a Galilean!”

60.text: But Peter said, “Sir, I do not know what you are talking about!” And immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

61.text: Then the Lord turned, and looked at Peter, and Peter remembered the Lord’s word, how he had said to him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”

62.text: So Peter went out and wept bitterly.

63.text: Now the men who held Jesus [in custody] were mocking him and beating him.

64.text: Having blindfolded him, they struck him on the face and asked him, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?”

65.text: They said many other insulting things to him.

66.text: As soon as it was day, the assembly of the presbyters of the people was gathered, both chief priests and scribes. They brought Jesus into their council, saying:

67.text: “If you are the Christ, tell us.” But Jesus said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe,

68.text: and if I also question [you], you will not answer me or release me.

69.text: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the Power of God.”

70.text: They all asked, “Are you then the Son of God?” He said to them, “You say it, for I am.”

71.text: Then they exclaimed, “Why do we need any more witnesses? We ourselves have heard [it] from his own mouth!”
